The Board of Trustees offers an opportunity for the public to address the Board in four sections of the agenda: on matters of concern about Closed Session items; on matters not appearing on the agenda; on action items contained in the Consent Agenda; and prior to voting on any item contained in the Action Agenda. Each speaker is encouraged to submit a comment card to the Board clerk in order to be recognized to speak.
	Per Board Policy, three minutes may be allotted to each speaker with a maximum of 30 minutes per subject. No action or discussion shall be undertaken on any public comments except that members of the Board or its staff may briefly respond to or ask a question for clarification regarding statements made or questions posed by persons addressing the Board under this agenda item.
	For information and disability access to materials, call 408-270-6402. Meetings are held in a location accessible to the disabled.

items.item_details:
At the August 13, 2013, Board Meeting, the Colleague ERP Conversion Approach Document was shared with the board as an information item with the understanding that a more detailed plan would follow on the September 10 agenda.  The work of providing three options is completed and was presented at the September 10, 2013 Board Meeting. At the September meeting the board approved an Ellucian sole source addendum that included software and services discounts that would expire on September 30, 2013.  Other aspects of the project are going out for RFP.  In parallel with these efforts, the District is ready to move forward with the purchase of the hardware required to run the new ERP system. 
	 
WSCA Contract Purchase:
An award to Dasher Technologies in the amount of $818,000 for HP hardware and software and related installation services for the ERP platform.  This platform includes production, test, and development systems (all virtualized); as well as, Disaster Recover and Business Continuity (high availability design) with a failover capability and backup.  Use of WSCA contract pricing to make award is preferred as this is a nationally competitively bid contract that is used by the state of California for hardware and software purchases. Dasher Technologies is a local, small, woman owned business that is certified by the California Department of General Services as a fulfillment partner for the WSCA/NASPO contract for HP hardware, software and services.
	 
The San Jose Evergreen Community College District currently uses the WSCA contract extensively to purchase computer equipment, for example, all Dell PC purchases are via this contract.  WSCA purchases is allowed per California Public Contract Code Section 20652, “the governing board of any community college district without advertising for bids, and when the board has determined it to be in the best interest of the district, may authorize by contract, lease, requisition, or purchase order . . . [to] purchase materials, supplies, equipment . . . and other personal property for the district in the manner in which the public corporation or agency is authorized by law to make the lease or purchase.” The contract must be based on a previously competitively awarded contract and based on the same terms and conditions of that contract. The WSCA contract is widely used in the state of California and adheres to Contract Code Section 20652. SJECCD benefits further by having a local company available that can fulfill the District's requirements.
	 
Note: Future RFP awards will be forthcoming for the following services in the next 120 days.  These awards are an integral part of this project:
	 
Project Management for conversion effort moving Colleague from Oracle to Microsoft SQL including: hardware installation, migration of software, migration of data, BPR, technical conversion, and Analytics.
Business Process Review (BPR) and optimization of each Colleague module (Student, Finance, Financial Aid, Human Resources) including “as-is” and “to-be” models, and implementation of “to-be” of new modules (Student Planning, Portal).
Colleague technical support for conversion to include: remediate issues found in BPR work, supply data conversion framework, assist in data clean-up, review of custom programs, re-write custom reports, design a custom-reporting strategy, technical training for data conversion.
Database administrator support services (configuration of target databases, migration of data, testing of database functionality.
Business intelligence and Analytics reporting services.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees award Dasher Technologies the hardware setup and configuration portion of the ERP Conversion project in an amount not to exceed $818,000.

items.item_details:
The District and Colleges are pursuing a number of Measure G-2004 funded projects that are in need of project management assistance:
	 
Joint Use 21st Century Education Center in Milpitas – The District needs project leadership to facilitate the programming, design, and construction of the future building.
	 
Physical Education Building (SJCC) - The College has not been able to commit the level of resources required to manage this project.  The PE complex project has a direct impact on the Measure G-2010 bond and without support the delay of this project has a negative impact to the G-2010 program and risks escalation costs associated with the delay.
	 
Modernization of Existing Facilities (EVC) - EVC expects to hire design firms, consultants and construction services for various projects including security infrastructure, new structures for grounds equipment and warehouse, and new bleachers at the soccer athletic field. 
	 
East Plaza Reconfiguration (EVC) – As part of the overall campus site improvements the College has identified reconfiguration of the plaza and bus drop-off at the east section of the College as a priority.  EVC expects to hire design firms, consultants and construction services to perform this work.  The Board will be asked to approve this new project as part of a Measure G-2004 Bond List Revision at its November 12, 2013 Board meeting.
	 
Central Green Development (EVC) – The center of campus formerly housed a cluster of portable buildings as temporary classrooms.  These were removed in 2012.  As part of the overall campus site improvements the College has identified development of the important area of the College as a priority.  EVC expects to hire design firms, consultants and construction services to perform this work.  The Board will be asked to approve this new project as part of a Measure G-2004 Bond List Revision at its November 12, 2013 Board meeting.
	 
Division of State Architect (DSA) – Closeout efforts continue with DSA on uncertified projects.  In many cases the applications have been closed as uncertified and must be reopened, additional fees paid, prior design firms contacted, old files researched and new applications with supporting documentation submitted.  Some of these uncertified projects are interfering with approval of applications for new projects and have the potential to create delays until the uncertified projects are satisfactorily closed out.

items.item_details: This study session is presented in compliance with BP: 2740 Board Education;  and is part of the San Jose-Evergreen Community College District Board Training and Development approved on April 23, 2013. The purpose of this presentation is to provide an overview of AB 1725, The Community College Reform Act of 1988; while focusing on that portion of the legislation that established  revised governance processes for the entire community college system. Specifically AB 1725 requested that the Board of Governors of the California Community Colleges implement a procedure designed to “ensure faculty, staff, and students...the right to participate effectively in district and college governance” and, further, to ensure “the right of academic senates to assume primary responsibility for making recommendations in the areas of curriculum and academic standards” [Education Code §70902(b)(7)].
